title: [GAMEPLAY] Kled Can Reactive His E On A Deceased Target
body: I was trying out Kled in a custom bot game. Sometime into the game I walked over to Cloud Drake and started to kill it. I killed the dragon with my E and even though it was dead, I was able to reactivate my E. I also tried it on blue buff and I was still able to reactive my E after killing blue buff with it. I then tried the same thing on champions. I entered a new custom game as Kled against Tristana. I got her to low hp and made sure to kill her with my E. After killing her with my E I still able to dash back through her by reactivating my E even though she was dead. I'm not sure if this was intended but I do not think being able reactivate Kled E on a deceased target is it's intended use. If anyone could recreate this for me and record it, it would be greatly appreciated as I don't have the ability to record myself. Thank you for taking the time to read this and have a great day!

replies.body:
Totally intended. Also nicely written subject line.
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
I'm not sure if it's a bug, can you confirm if it's intended for kled's E to reveal stealthed targets?
How else is Kled going to know where he's going to go? Seems logically reasonable.
I don't know, Kled seems like the kind of champ who'd just take a guess.
This is some excellent Kled logic. But that makes me wonder... Kled logic or Draven logic, not sure which is better

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Exgeniar,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=izbnjU2f,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2016-09-05T08:36:03.218+0000)
>
> How else is Kled going to know where he's going to go? Seems logically reasonable.

Thanks for the reply, I wasn't sure why he would be able to, or really need to, dash through a target that's already dead but I appreciate the clarification!

Thanks for the reply, I appreciate it!
